author: Brad Waite
title: Good quality for the price.
content: By no means am I an expert with headphones. I bought these because I wanted something better than the super-cheap Walmart ones I had been using.  These have a very good bass, the sound is good, and the padding eliminates most of the room noise. The cord is plenty long and seems to be made of high quality silicone rubber. The plug end is metal, and has a metal spring to help prevent damage. Overall the quality seems rather good. I don't think you can go wrong for the money spent.

author: Omi & Tela
title: Great Quality and easy to store.
content: I was looking for headphones to send in my sons book-bag daily for him to use in the computer lab.  I was able to store easily in his back bag and he can listen to his lesson with everything else going on.

author: Vamsi Danturti
title: AMAZING SOUND!
content: I am a seventh grader that uses this product. My brother is a fourth grader who also uses the headphones. This is an amazing product that produces good tone quality and is decently good at noise cancellation. It is so good to use while doing my online homework. I can block out all the sounds while playing video games on my computer. Before, in class, when my friends all had to watch an educational video, I had no headphones to do the job. I had to do it at home. But when I got this, I could do it with ease! My brother thinks the same with high praises. It also looks good on our heads. I have just one thing to say, though. It is too powerful. When I keep it at maybe a volume 10 out of 100, everyone not wearing headphones can hear it clearly. Thank you for reading!

author: Living the Dream
title: ... for someone else and they were so cushioned and nice sounding that we ordered two more pair
content: We ordered one pair for someone else and they were so cushioned and nice sounding that we ordered two more pair! Love the volume adjust feature and the one sided cord too. Great price and great product!! Thank you!

author: Jessie
title: Headphones work great!
content: The sound quality of these is great for the price. I wanted an extremely budget friendly pair of headphones. They do not block noise surrounding you, but I didn't want that because I need to be able to hear what's going on around me and didn't want to be completely blocked when using them. Once you are playing music or a video, the  sound does help to block the noises around you if noise cancellation is something that you do want.

author: Wiiviewer
title: Good Headphones with one drawback.
content: These are good headphones.  Everything in them sound clear and it's easy to fold up.  The one downside I found is the AUX plug, it's too big for my phone and every time I want to plug it in, I have to take off my case.

author: C. Carrillo
title: I can finally listen to music for most of the day
content:
I tried all the earbuds, all the types, styles, etc and I give up.  Either they're uncomfortable or they fall out (yes I've tried the different sizes of pads too).  Also, I don't want to fuss with bluetooth because I pair my phone with a speaker at home, but I want to listen privately at work, and switching back and forth is too much hassle.  Plus a wire doesn't bother me.
The are quite comfortable.  The only problem I have is they are just a little tight, which is surprising since I have a small-ish head.  They tend to hurt my ears after a while but that's mainly because I wear glasses.... So not entirely the headphone's fault.  Next time I get new glasses I'll opt for frames with thinner ear pieces, that should do the trick.

They have very good sound, especially for $15.  And the pads and headstrap are comfortable.

author: Regina Shiderly
title: Love these so much more than ear buds!
content: I love these, they do what I need them to do and they do it well. I use these to complete school work at night while the tv is playing as my husband watches television so they cancel out the noise very well.  My chromebook also has low sound and I can barely hear from the speakers, so these headphones amplify the sound so well I can hear with no problem even with background noise. I use these with a Dell chrome book and it is plug and play. No special installations needed. Great product for the price, absolutely recommended.

author: Elizabeth D
title: Amazing Headphones for a Great Price!
content: These are AMAZING headphones for such a cheap price. I use them when I am going to bed as my hubby snores. They almost completely block out the cacophony of his sleep sounds, which is really impressive. The sound quality is excellent and they are very comfortable.

author: Nyla P.
title: Great product for sound.
content: I wanted some lightweight headphones to wear in the house and noise-cancelling not necessary for this use.  These are great for that.  The connector is metal enclosed so I am sure it will withstand time and use.  The sound quality is quite nice.  The cushioned ear pads are comfortable.  And although they are lightweight, the part that goes over the head is a bit small for my head, and I was never able to actually “forget” they were there.  (I have a big head.).  For that reason, and that reason alone, I will return them.  However, overall, this is a nice product and I urge others to consider purchasing.

author: A Satisfied Customer
title: Great build and sound quality, comfortable, and amazing value.
content: Purchased these for an office environment. Headphones are simplistic and sleek looking, not too eye-catching (in a good way). The sound is comparable to higher-priced headphones I've tried in the past - Punchy bass, clear highs, and a good soundstage. They feel snug but not tight, and are closed-back so they block a lot of external noise out and do not leak sound either. I did not purchase these for the microphone, but it is helpful to have and picks up fairly clear quality sound. Certainly one of the best performance-to-value ratio headphones out there.

author: Bethany L.
title: Good for gaming and movies
content:
I like these.  Good value.  Reasonable comfort.  Great sound block.  Good audio.
I couldn't get an expensive pair and read extensive reviews before choosing.  They live up to the reviews.
They aren't $200 headphones but there are a very good deal for what I paid. I am happy with them unlike my last 4 pairs which hurt,  blocked no sound,  had bad audio,  or broke.

author: Nicholas Wagner
title: Really great value for an excellent price!
content: My old headphones had a short in it and when I went to go buy the same pair I discovered the price had gone up by $30!!! I tried these based on the excellent reviews and the price super reasonable so I decided to give them a try.  I have only had them for a few days so I can't say how well they will hold up yet, but the sound quality and volume control is really good.  I'm very pleased with this purchase.  You can't beat it for the price! Hopefully they will last me a good while!

author: Amazon Customer
title: High quality sound, comfortable headphones!
content: I was VERY surprised at the great sound from these very inexpensive  headphones.  I wear headphones in my art class so I can listen to music while I'm painting. My old headphones were falling apart, so I did a search on Amazon, and found these.  They are soooo much better than my old headphones!  My expectations were low because they were so cheap compared to other headphones, but they are wonderful!!

author: Richard Bishop
title: not bad
content: The sound quality is pretty good for 14 bucks.Im used to older eighties head phones that cover the entire ear,These sit on top instead of around the ear like my old ones but those were a hundred bucks back in the day.I bought these more for curiosity because of the price.not bad but I think Ill still look for a little higher quality sounding pair.

author: Roberto Wittmann Jiménez
title: Good sound quality at a very affordable cost
content: Overall, my recent purchase of the Vogek Lightweight Portable Fold-Flat Stereo Bass Headphones has proven to be a satisfying one. Although there are many more brands offering state-of-the-art products in this same niche, this Vogek ones are well-made, sound quality is very good and tend to isolate a great deal of external noise. In terms of delivery, their distributor did a fine job --the product was shipped and delivered even before expected date.

author: Tavian
title: Great Product For the price
content:
For the price these headsets are great. I bought two of them for podcast and commentary purposes. I like the 5ft cord and the fact that it folds up back into its box. They are very convenient. The only downside is that my head is large and prolonged use requires adjustments from time to time because they start to hurt my ears a bit.

If your looking for good over the ear headphones there are legit a good deal!

author: Chris M
title: Perfect for my 3 year old
content: These are perfect for my 3 year old to use with his iPad. The sound is great for him since he doesn’t need it loud and they won’t break easy with how easy and smooth they move

author: Brandon
title: Buy these
content:
Because of the price, I had very low expectations of this headset. The thousands of overly  positive reviews made me a little suspicious, but my wireless headset was just about dead and I needed something, even if it was just temporary.

The sound quality is very impressive. They're not as comfortable as the $70 over-the-ear headset I have, but they're not uncomfortable and they're also not as hot. I tested out the mic by recording my voice and it sounds good to me. Don't try and hold the mic up to your mouth, it'll sound worse that way.

Note that if you have a laptop or computer with multiple audio ports you will need an adapter cable to use the mic. I bought the "Headset Splitter Cable for PC" and it lets the mic work just fine.

author: S Y.
title: Great for working in a cubicle!
content: Work in a cubicle and got these headphones for minimizing noise and distractions. I sometimes put them on but don't even turn on the music just to drown out the office noise. But when I do have music on the sound is great too!

author: That one guy
title: Small, Great Sounding , and Versatile Headphones for the Price
content:
Good headphones for the price. These exceeded my expectations. For a brand I never heard of, I was surprised of the sound quality and details of the build. They are small and versatile when your on the go and have a long enough wire to extend comfortably. Near the headphone jack, there is some wire support so you won't find exposed wire anytime soon. The headband is on the smaller side, but you can adjust the sides to the height of your head.

Place with caution as some vital areas are made out of plastic they may break if sat on or squished. It would be great if it had a volume control, but I understand it may be because to keep the costs down. The microphone works no problem as I used it for a few phone calls.

author: M. Wall
title: White and gold Vogek Headphones
content: Nice looking head phones. Bought 2 pair of different cheap head phones along with these, these are my favorite. Best sound of the 3 on low output device's.....tested with Kindle. Best at high output too...tested with Onkyo home reciever. Bass hits hard on high output, shakes your head. I don't want to step on any toes, so i will just say headphones on the left side of the picture are my second favorite and ones on the very right are my very, very, least favorite.

author: Joe
title: This is a great product for the price!
content:
Pros:  Compact, small, good sound quality, has the ability to block out some sound, sound quality is very decent, and I like the fact that it does have some actual base, unlike my old pair. I almost forgot - Comfortable!  I have a relatively large head and these fit nicely on my head and over my ears.  You can't go wrong for this price.  I replaced two apple ear buds because I got tired of something being in my ear and was looking for something relatively inexpensive that could provide good quality and these compete for sure.  The 3.5mm jack is the best. its mesh like end provides the ability to grab on to and pull out of the 3.5mm port.  I constantly struggled with my old ear buds with these its much easier to unplug if you have to do a lot of that.

Cons:  I know I have a microphone.. the only thing I don't know on it is whether or not when i push the button if its on or off.  I would have liked to have a small red LED to identify when its on or off.

Overall:  Great product for the right price.

UPDATE:  Been using these for a solid week, noise canceling is better than I thought and the bass is actually really good.

author: ShellySlaczka
title: Better Than Expected
content: I had purchased this to use with my laptop and IPad. I really don’t use headphones with those devices much so I wasn’t looking for anything expensive. I am was more than surprised and impressed by the quality of these. They are incredibly comfortable and the sound is great. This is definitely a great value.

author: ClassicRock
title: High Quality Basic Headphones that Don't Need Charging
content: Going on a trip and not knowing where to find/charge batteries, makes this pair of headphones a no brainer.  Not wireless but corded and does a decent job of blocking some noise.  Very affordable, too.

author: Marine49
title: Great headphones!
content: These headphones are outstanding! They surpassed my expectations for comfort and sound quality. The folding aspect is great. It allows for easy  storage in the drawer of my computer desk when they aren't being used. Headphone construction and sound quality are better than higher priced ones I have owned. I highly recommend these if you're looking for quality headphones without draining your wallet . These are truly great headphones!

author: John Hines
title: Inexpensive collapsible on-ear headphones with microphone that work on phone, tablet, or desktop.
content:
Good inexpensive on-ear headphones that plug into your phone, tablet, or desktop.  And, they are inexpensive so my granddaughter can steal as many sets as she needs  The construction is sturdier than ear buds.  The set folds down to smaller than the size of your hand and I don't expect it to break when I unfold it

BTW:  I'm an old guy with bad ears (too many years standing up close to the band) so don't take my sound quality evaluation too seriously.  But, they are inexpensive and sturdy.

author: TinyLittleTurtle
title: Definitely worth the money!
content: Bought these for my kids but i took the opportunity to try them first. They needed to have good clarity and range as they are being used exclusively for them to practice piano and guitar without driving me crazy. Haha. These are great for they money and are better quality than i expected. Added bonus that my boys haven’t destroyed they yet. I like the cushion on top as my youngest has long hair and didn’t want it to get tangled.

author: Pionus
title: Great headphones!
content: Wow! Love these! Bought two! The sound is very good. Big Bang for the buck! I love that there is metal on the end so it doesn’t break. Padding is good and padding on the top of the headband. I have fallen a sleep in these.

author: Ilene Holliday
title: Exactly what I was looking for
content: All I need is a way by which to listen to YouTube videos and other things on my Chromebook while my husband is watching TV.  These are comfortable, have good sound fill my need.  Also, the folding feature will be handy when we travel.

author: Katie Nelson
title: Decent for the price
content: These were pretty decent for being only $15. I used them on my phone and the phone calls were very clear. I could hear the person very good. Listening to music was ok. I thought the bass in them was too much even after fixing the equalizer on my controls. The sound was pretty good. They seemed to fit my head pretty good. They weren’t the tightest of headphones on me and I had it set the smallest it would go. I felt like they might slip off if I did a lot of moving around but they were comfortable.

author: Deborah Petersen
title: Really good sound quality!
content: These headphones deliver surprisingly good sound quality for the price. We are going to purchase another pair because we liked them so much! They are kind of large so keep this in mind if you have a smaller head.

author: Veronica Lee Hammer
title: Best On-Ear Headphones For The Price!
content:
This is definitely a 5 start product, especially considering the price!

It isn't noise-canceling, but I didnt expect it to be.

The sound quality is A+ and the comfort and fit are superb.

I love that the base of the cord has a metal protector to prevent fraying and damage.

This is exactly what I was looking for!

I will definately purchase this again, as a gift.

author: Kelly
title: My son loves these!
content:
So I had my gamer son review these for me and this is what he had to say:

They are lightweight and don't squeeze his head.
The sound quality is great as long as you don't turn them up too loud during gaming.  If you do it echos in the other person's ears.
He loves the fact they fold over and rest on your shoulders so he can turn his head and not feel like he's being smacked in the face by the pads.  They lay flat and he forgets he has them on.
The mic works great.
The cord is a good length.

He said he'd give them 5 stars if it weren't for the fact they aren't noise cancelling.

Great product and awesome price!

author: Chicka777
title: Perfect for long flights
content: I don’t like earbuds. Wedging them in my ears gross me out plus they start to irritate after a bit but I often fly so I wanted something so I can watch my shows or listen to music. These are perfect. Nothing fancy but they do the job. Plus they fold up to store very easily. Great purchase especially since they were so cheap!

author: Tech Whiz
title: Awesome headphones 🎧
content:
So I was looking for a cheap pair of on ear headphones because I have about like 50 earbuds and I found these and I was like, these r amazing, they are extremely cheap, good sound quality, has phone remote, and is very easy to retract and store
I really recommend these vogek headsets :-)

author: Maddi Pappalardo
title: The most frustrating headphones on the market, if that’s what you’re into
content: It’s hilarious to me that the product description specifically notes that this ONE AND A HALF METER chord is perfect because it doesn’t snag. It’s absurdly long and snags on literally everything. It happens at least once a day, which causes the headphones to unplug themselves and explains why they’ve now shorted out and I have to wrap the chord to hear out of one side, and they snagged going through the train turnstile and broke my phone screen. They’re also weirdly big, and the smallest setting is still too long for my ears, which gets really uncomfortable. Can’t say much for the noice cancellation when I’m not playing audio, but as far as sound they get the job done. Audio quality is good, not mind blowing, but you get what you pay for I guess. It also really bothers me that there’s a button on the chord whose seemingly only function is to pause what you’re listening to, no volume control, you can’t even skip tracks. Overall I recommend these if you have a long torso, a big head, and only listen to podcasts. Otherwise, there’s better stuff out there if you’re on a budget

author: Marsha A. Lavoie
title: Good replacement headphones
content: I needed new headphones after my daughter "borrowed" the ones she had given me for a Christmas gift. These are just the ticket. They are comfortable and sound quality is good. I like that the cord is only on one side, as it makes it less likely that the cord will get tangled and/or pulled too much (which is how my old headphones had gotten damaged). With proper care these should last a long time - at least if I can keep them away from my daughter.

author: Northern Virginia
title: Must Adjust Volume via Device Connected To
content:
Other than the note in my headline, really like these.

They are very comfortable and lightweight.  Using for my iPhone and friends sharing they can hear me well.

Love the color too. Do not like the fact that I have to go to my device to adjust volume vs using a switch on the cord

author: Crystal
title: Great Sound!
content: Good strong sound! Sound does however (from time to time) drift from ear to ear instead of being in both ears. But overall the sound quality is very very good! Glad I purchased! And the headphones themselves are COMFY!!!

author: Who Dat
title: Very good headphones for the price & portable too!
content:
These were purchased for children to use in school with an IPad.

Here's the pros and cons, in my opinion:

Pros:
- Good sound quality
- Very portable (love that they fold up)
- Cord permanently secured to the headset (kids cannot lose the plug)

Cons:
- Didn't have a case (unless you want to keep them in the box)
- Small earpieces (great for kids, not so much for adults)

TBD on durability since we've only had them for a week, but aside from that, I'd write that these are near perfect for their intended use.

author: savvas a savva
title: NO BRAINER. RUN TO BUY THEM.
content:
What an absolute bargain !. They fold up very small and so are good to travel with. Headphone sensitivity seems high as they are easy to drive load. Plenty of base and treble. A superb sounding pair of Headphones. A tremendous value and no need to buy anything else unless you're looking for bluetooth or something that these cannot provide.
Easy recommendation.

author: Kemo
title: REALLY diggin these headphones!
content: These headphones are well worth the price. If you're just looking for a pair of really good headphones without breaking the bank then you found them right here. They come compact in their own box with an automatic one year warranty from the company. VERY comfortable, stylish (if you're into that) noise cancellation is on point for me and the audio quality is AMAZING. Great headphones for a GREAT price!

author: Douglas Lawson
title: Tight!
content: The product appears to be made well but they're so tight I can barely keep them on my head for a few minutes before my  ears feel like they're being pressed into a crepe.

author: nh_handyman
title: Good stuff cheap
content: If your from New England, yes I borrowed the Building 19 tag line.  These are good headphones for the price.  I use them in my office environment (shared office) and they work great at cutting down on the background conversations.  Not too much pressure on my ears either (I've been told I have a big head!).

author: amethyst52
title: Good quality for the price.
content: I like these very much.  The only issue I have is they are very tight on my head and there is no way to adjust the camber.  Another reviewer mentioned this.  I use these for watching TV and listening to podcasts on my iPad.

author: B
title: One side doesn’t work
content: I was sooo excited about these headphones, unfortunately the one I got doesn’t work on one side! 😔 I gave it two stars because the side that works sounds decent I’m just bummed that I have to return them.

author: SimplyMe
title: ... computer because it is not Bluetooth and they work awesome they play so loud
content: Brought it just for some basic headphones to listen to my computer because it is not Bluetooth and they work awesome they play so loud. My son tried mines and liked them even though the price was low he thought they were awesome so I brought two more one for each my boys.

author: J. Hancock
title: Best one so far
content: Over the past few years, I have ordered many "cheapest headphones on Amazon" and I must say that this is the first one that doesn't feel cheap. The cord seems solid and respectable, the button is nice and clicky, the sound quality is WAY better than I am used to in this price range. I expect a certain level of un-quality when I get cheap headphones and this is the first time that it feels like I ordered a more expensive set. Couldn't be happier.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Vogek On Ear Headphones are great!
content: I ordered these Vogek On Ear Headphones for my husband.  He loves them!  He say they work great!  He can hear clearly and also cancels out any noise in room giving him clear listening.Vogek Headphones

author: SnowlandLiz
title: Great headphones at a great price
content: I wanted to get a pair of headphones that I can use on my computer that sounded good but were not overly expensive.  After doing a lot of searching and reading reviews I decided to get these headphones.  So far I am very happy with them.  They sound good, are comfortable and I don’t have to worry about batteries going dead like I would if they were Bluetooth.

author: Richard J. Nelson
title: A+ headphones
content: Simple, sleek, and A+ headphones. This is the headphone I use in podcast and research areas. I use it and I would recommend.

author: Jenna Petrykowski
title: For the price, this hit hard
content: For the low price, you cant be the quality. I was INCREDIBLY surprised when I put them on and placed a song with some bass in it. Well worth the cost. They do not cancel noise, and people can hear them if your in a quiet room so that's a drawback, but I just use them for listening to music while editing photos. Again, for the price it's worth it.

author: Matthew
title: Smaller than they look
content: Purchased these so I could watch videos on the TV without disturbing my partner while she was working or doing other things. When plugged into an extension for some reason that I need to have the plug only three quarters of the way in to get both ears to work. When casting YouTube videos and listening through these headphones the mic button messes with the sound and makes it much lower volume.

author: Braddah
title: Good headphones
content: Bought these for my mom so that she can talk on the phone while she’s cooking. They’re very affordable and has decent sound quality for the price. I would definitely buy them again.

author: HAP
title: Great Speakers At A Very Low Price
content: I have truly been enjoying these headphones. The sound quality is very good. There's no buzzing or feedback sounds that sometimes come with inexpensive headphones. The only drawback is that there is no volume control.

author: Bigguy
title: Nice Storage Options
content: These seem to be a great headset. They came in a box far smaller then I thought it would. In fact I kept that box because it was quite amazing that a headset like this could fit in it. That way I store them when I move. The cord was long enough for what I needed. The lack of volume control on the headset itself was kinda sad, but all in all a solid headset with a couple nice features, and for the price...I shall look for these again when I need the next pair.

author: Selena
title: Perfect!
content: I absolutely love this product! Very affordable and excellent quality, they look expensive and sturdy,  the sound quality is very good, padded ear cushions make them very comfortable and really cancel all the noise you just enjoy the music. I'm very happy with my purchase.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Best on-ear headphones under $25. Durable!
content:
If you search Amazon, under category On-Ear Headphones under $25, the Vogek is the first non-sponsored result. At 4-1/2 stars in 1878 reviews so far, it's worth a look.

My wife bought the headphones to use for playing educational tapes on a 20-year old (pre-bluetooth) Panasonic tape player.

Surprise! The headphones are excellent. The sound quality is very good. Notice the steel reinforcement around the cable near the jack, so that the cable doesn't break off there. The plastic seems to be sturdy and durable. We like how the headphones fold flat, but the ear cups swivel to fit comfortably over the ears.

Another thing you can use the headphones for is phone calls, because there is a mic in-line. I think the phone call experience is going to take a step up!

At $11.04 Amazon Prime, this is a good deal! Five stars.

Full disclosure: this review was solicited by the seller. However, it's a real review by a real customer.

author: W.S.
title: Rich full sound...unexpected for the price
content: When I received these headphones, the ear pieces were a bit smaller than I had anticipated. That being said, I unfolded them and they fit over my big head and the cushions were incredibly soft and comfortable on my ears. These do not cancel noise or block out noise and since that wasn't why I bought them, I didn't have that expectation. The wire has a small spring near the 3.5 mm plug, I assume to keep the wire from kinking and killing the sound (A common problem). The wire itself has a cheap plastic feeling and there is only the standard plastic grommet thing (technical term) the wire passes through were it connects to the headphones itself (Another common failure point). I plugged them up to my computer and ran some audio tests and these speakers had a rich range of sound that sounded better than the expensive speakers I have attached. The only thing I didn't test was bass because that is not my thing. Overall II am very pleased with the build quality and sound for the price. I would recommend these looking for a comfortable, great sounding pair of headphones at an affordable price.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great Pair Of Headphones For Cheap Price
content: This is my second pair of Vogek headphones. I unfortunately pulled out the cord on my first pair by accident. I came back to the brand because I was very satisfied with the sound quality that these headphones provided. I'm not audio expert, but the sound from these head phones is high quality, and they do a great job of cancelling out outside noise. With the padded adjustable band, they fit quite nicely on my rather average head. For an idea of what I listen to, I tend to listen to a lot of Rammstein when I'm using these, and the music sounds just excellent. Will probably buy another set again at some point.

author: lwhewett
title: Great headphone at inexpensive cost!
content: Because our living room/tv room has a very high ceiling my wife and I have a hard time listening to the TV.  We purchased a transmitter that sends a sound signal to a small receiver that you can plug a couple of headphones in to listen to the TV with better sound.  Finding the right headphones/earphones to listen with has been somewhat of an issue so I saw these Vogek headphones at Amazon.  They looked good and the price was very good so we ordered them.  When they came we pulled up a movie and plugged in the headphones.  The sound is terrific and because of the padding and fit they were very comfortable.  After wearing them through a 2 hour movie there was no discomfort and we were very happy to be able to understand the dialogue and enjoy the movie.  I've connected a pair to my ipod to listen to an audiobook and music and they work very well on that device.  They have a built in mic but haven't tried do a phone call yet.  We are very happy with our Vogek headphones.  They seem well constructed and have a sturdy cord so it appears they will be usable for quite some time.  Oh - they came in a little box about an inch and a half thick and when we finished listening we were able to fold them up and place them back in the box to store them in a drawer on our TV stand until the next time we need them!

author: K7
title: Great quality
content: Overall, at the price point, it doesn't get much better. Sound quality is great (bass junkie here, and the headphones can handle it), comfy fit, cord length is sufficient, and in comparison to my $60 headphones, these hold their ground. Do recommend, well worth the price.

author: Wife2MVP
title: Designer style and noise cancelling!
content:
My 10 year old wanted some on ear headphones that folded up small. I chose these because she loves rose gold. The box they came in was so small. They fold up so compactly but snap into place and stay in place well. The cushions are really soft and they adjust easily and hold their fit. They look
super expensive and high end.  My daughter loves them and I tried them and was surprised how noise cancelling they really were. Great purchase!

author: Ricardo Mayans
title: Does the job
content: I haven't personally used it. I bought them for my 6th grader because it was part of his supply list. I love that it folds flat and can be kept in his backpack without breaking. He says they're good.

author: MEP
title: HORRIBLE CHEMICAL SMELL!!!
content: Received  the case and it has the most terrible smell.  It is not worth the trouble to EVEN send it back!  Do not buy this case..we are throwing it and hopefully it will not kill any animals near the landfill!!!

author: Mary C.
title: Love these headphones!
content: These headphones are exactly what I wanted.  It was important to me that they be reasonably priced, comfortable, clear sound, and plug into my ipad/computer.  These fit the bill completely.  They are as, if not more comfortable than a much more expensive blue tooth set I have.  I would strongly recommend these to everyone!

author: Sabrina
title: Headphones

author: Janet Chandler
title: Good Value, Excellent Product
content: This might very well be the best set of headphones I have ever come across. Very reasonably price for as well as it works which to me is as well as some of those headphones that sell for 3 to 4 times more. For those more expensive ones you are usually paying more for the brand name then how well the headphones work. In the end it is price and quality that really matter and these headphones get 5 stars for both. It isn't just the sound quality though that gives it 5 stars. The ear pads on these headphones are very cushy which makes for a comfortable listening experience while playing your favorite tunes. As for anything negative I would say the noise cancellation is very good but doesn't block out all outside noise. But these headphones scores more positive points then negative ones with that one minor complaint. All in all if you are in the market for a set of headphones at a great price I would recommend these.

author: Calintx
title: You get what you pay for
content:
As others have mentioned, the earphones are position very low relative to ear level (even for those with a big head like me). As a result, the muffs rests on an awkward position, causing soreness on the cartilaginous area of the ear. It becomes irritating after 20 mins of wearing. The sound quality is okay for the price, but nothing to write home about. The adapter for these headphones stays aggressively attached to whatever you’re attaching it to, but the sound gets buzzy with the slightest movement of the adapter. It gets annoying after a while if you’re doing physical activity with these on.
Personally, I would not recommend these headphones. Invest a little more money if you want a main day by day pair of headphones. Although, these would probably make great backups or headphones you could take on a plane and don’t mind the risk of losing on vacation.

author: ironman96

The sounds quality is very good as well. At this price, this is an excellent set of headphones.

author: Xmetal
title: Cheap in price, SUPER comfortable, and have potential, but muddy mids, are holding them back
content:
(note: I'd say these are a 3.5 out of 5 ... I had to choose 3 OR 4 out of 5, overall for Amazon's ratings)
-------
Without boring people with a full rundown of different headphones I use regularly, but just to name a few if people are wondering about how these compare to models generally in the same price-range,

I have used/still use (All of these ARE Sony) MDRV150, ZX310's, and some ZX100 and/or ZX110's.

One thing I will mention here is while I have worn then for hours at a time, I cant speak (on any topic with these) for long term use as in months down the line.

First Impressions:
  The moment I opened the box, I thought they looked small, though they fit just fine.  I have a pair of Sony ZX310's that fold the same way and when I compare them next to each other, they do look the same, size wise, so I guess my eyes were playing tricks on me.  There is nothing wrong with the size.... maybe the earcups on the outside (just for looks) could be a tad bigger, but that is not where I'd tell the company to invest $$ to make these better.

Sound:
  This would be a Con ..... sort of .... well if there is any big cons with these, it's the sound  ...  it's not terrible ... it really isn't but it's not great either ... I have been messing with my eq's on my mp3 (sansa) mp3 players and my computer media players, to give these a fair shot.

  The Bass is Ok, the highs may be able to have improvement but the mids/mid-to-highs sound very muddy to me...remember I am not a regular user of say $100+ headphones so I understand things in this price range are not going to be perfect but I cant get the fact that these sound muddy to me, out of my head.  No matter what I do to the mids (EQ wise) the Lows and Highs sound off ... granted I have gotten use to their sound vs my other Sonys ... the Sony MDRV150's I have sounded way off to me too in the mid to high range at first.  I am much more of a fan of the Sony XZ100/110 series.

If all of this confuses you, just note that the muddy mids (say around the vocals) makes the sound, NOT sound "crisp" ..... this may be the TL/DR way of saying what I just did for sound quality

Build Quality:

  If you are even close to one of those people that have to have "premium quality" headphones you are not even considering  this price bracket anyway, however, for this price range these are not bad build quality wise ...

  Looking at pictures that other reviewers have posted, the wire seems thinner now that I have these, vs the images, but so for I suppose these are not bad.

  One thing I love is the almost spring (like you may find in some retractable pens ... as a comparison to what it looks like, I mean) around the end of the cable where headphone cables typically get flex damage causing one of the two sides to go out on you.  I am seeing this as something that will 100% protect against that happening and I wish other manufacturers would all include that little bit extra, that VOGEK has with these.

Comfort

  This is one reason I cant (so far)... bring myself to return these ... while I love my Sonys and they are by NO MEANS UNcomfortable .. these Vogek's are REALLY comfortable so far and even after hours of use, I have to say they are MORE comfortable then my Sonys..... not even counting the MDRV150's which felt tight and before I put more padding inside the earcups myself ... were even very LIGHTLY padded.

  Also these are not really over the ear headphones but the way the earcups sit on my ear these do block out alot of sound (not all, by any means ) noise that the Sony's do not ... note that NONE of these headphones are "noise cancelling".

Bottom Line:
  I want to like these more than I do but the muddy sound is a big issue.  If anyone from Vogek reads this ... I love these headphones and if the muddy sound in the mids, and maybe the sound would be more balanced.  If this is addressed and they sounded better in this regard, I may say these are better than my old favorite Sony ZX series headphones.  There are so many great things I love about these headphones but the mids being off and that making the sound seem unbalanced are holding these back from being at least a 4.5 out of 5 for me.

  If you are really curious about these, and see them at a good price, then these may be worth at least trying.

------
I have a pair of Sony ZX100's that while are not in the best condition, still work nearly 6+ years later (one key reason the they broke is user error ... I put them down way too hard once).... the POINT is that these may go for good any time now and even though we are getting out of storm season here in FL, I need pair I dont mind if they get a bit sweaty out in the summer months ... these may be my (that pair anyway) "ZX100 backup pair"

----
Update after another day or two of constantly using these: ... yeah .... I dont see myself buying this model again ... they are by far (and none of my Sonys are UNcomfortable) more comfortable than even my old favorites, but the mids (say vocals) being so off, no matter what I do ... that is an issue ... would I consider this brand again if they had a new model, and I saw reviews "they really improved the sound" ... 110% YES ... even now ... I dont see myself returning these ... I WANT to like them more but that sound is an issue ... the bass is good but they just sound unbalanced vs other headphones I have.

I cant speak from experience but at least one person on Amazon who has had this model and the new model (I wasn't even paying attention to that) says the sound inbalance issue seems to be improved according to them and what they think ... so when considering these and seeing "there is a newer model of these headphones" that Amazon shows ... you may want to consider those ... Vogek MAY have already addressed my big/ONLY issue with these.

Last Update: I do not want to turn this into a blog, so this will be the last update unless there is say complete failure or something.  I have to say that with my Sansa Fuze+ (one of my mp3 players) and the settings I have used for years with my Sony's  .... these do not sound as bad ... I still have the same comments about the mids and the Sony's are better for the most part ... at least the ZX100's and 110's ... but .. .these are more in the same ballpark now I have used them a bit more ... the mid's sound and the unbalanced sound is still there but that is the only big issue . .other than that I love these.  My final rating is still 3.5 ... not low enough for "3" but not high enough for a "4"... for $15.99 ... I'd consider going with the Sony's but some sellers have these for say $12 or less (what i paid) ... that is more reasonable .... The Sony's in general do not have as good Bass, BUT the sound including the mids at the same EQ settings on the same device just sound more balanced.

author: Abner Rosenweig
title: Great headphones on a budget
content:
In a public place or in shared living space, headphones become essential. I hadn't heard of the Vogek brand and was skeptical, but given the price, features, and 12-month warranty, I decided to give this pair a try.

I wasn't disappointed.

The headphones come in a compact box, demonstrating their portability. I can easily fold them into a slim pocket of my work bag, which means I can easily take them wherever I go.

The design is sleek and modern, enjoyable to look at.

The sound quality is full and rich, what you'd expect of a more expensive pair.

The padded headband and ear cushions make things comfortable, and the adjustable levels easily conform to my head.

I'd never had a tangle-free cord before -- it's surprisingly helpful and convenient.

I haven't used the mic yet but it will be helpful for video conferencing down the road.

One disappointment is the way the headphones conform to my ears. If I try to wear them in the correct position for more than 15 minutes, my ears hurt. My ears are somewhat elvish in shape, however, so I don't think this is a drawback most people would experience.

Overall, these headphones are a great choice. With all the features, the sound quality, and the stylish look, it's apparent that a great deal of thought and care went into the design and manufacture. I'm happy with the purchase and will look for other Vogek products in the future.

author: LesaS
title: These Headphones Surprised Me!
content:
This review is written my teenage daughter who listens to music way too much.

I bought these headphones to replace some cheap ones that broke. I take good care of my headphones, however I use them all the time. I use them for listening to music/audio books, watching YouTube, and completing online schoolwork. So, I was looking for something that can handle a lot of use and be inexpensive enough to easily replace. After searching trusty Amazon and reading lots of excellent reviews; I chose the Vogek On Ear Headphones with Mic.

My first impressions were really good. The packing was professional and the headphones arrived in perfect condition. I chose red because it's my favorite color and I was impressed by how well the color matched to the photo online. The build doesn't feel cheap, actually I think part of the outside of the ear cups is metal. I like this detail and it doesn't make the headphones feel too heavy. Also, these headphones are very flexible for whether you need to adjust them or fit them in a confined space. Unlike other inexpensive headphones that I've tried, I don't feel like these would break with average use anytime soon.

After some use, I grew to really love this product.  The cushioning inside the ear cups and on the headband is a pleather material, however it's conformable even for long periods of listening to music. Sound quality is great and definitely worth the money. There's a tiny control box with the mic and one button. I discovered that this button pauses and plays your music/audiobook. It's very useful and a nice touch. The microphone is okay, I tested it on phone. It sounds a little muddy, but very understandable. I have the RIG 400HX Gaming Headset for my gaming and communicating, however this microphone would be fine for a quick match of Fortnite. I'll probably use these headphones for when I get a Nintendo Switch as they're more practical for portable gaming.

Overall, I highly recommend these headphones. They're great for somebody looking for awesome quality in an inexpensive package.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Excellent purchase- true sound, soft and light muffs, no RF radiation, wonderful price
content:
These Vogek headphones exceed my expectations.
The base has a live presence.
They rest lightly but securely on my head and ears.
I regularly hear sounds, tones, and aspects of music and narrations which I have never heard on expensive earbuds etc.
I have compared these to a Bose set and only think it crazy to purchase Bose over these.
I wanted a pair of headphones that had no Bluetooth or other form of wireless RF radiation.
I did not want noise cancelling headphones because I did not want to be entirely shut off from my home and environment when I use them. I find these to have a perfect balance of noise cancellation without total lose of sound from my surroundings.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great sound in a lightweight and comfortable package
content:

Sound quality is excellent and, even at high volume, distortion is not noticeable.  Those that habitually jog alongside busy and dangerous streets will be glad to know that background sounds will not be entirely overridden.
Strain relief is provided at both ends of the cable.  The headset’s band is adjustable to account for head size, and the earpieces can be twisted and folded for storage.  An inline microphone allows this device to be used with a cellphone.
I like the Voget headphone.  It is comfortable, inexpensive, and provides excellent sound.

author: Becky Jo
title: Easy to wear
content: I have these on for hours at a time while I work.  After many hours the pressure on my ears can be to intense.  These are a lot easier to keep on my head for hours.  They have good sound quality as well for the price.

author: Dominic
title: Great bang for the buck
content:
So I waited a little while to review these headphones.  I wanted to get proper use out of them before I wrote this review.  I had previously purchased SONY noise cancelling headphones and I was very dissatisfied with them.  I purchased these after reading other reviews plus the fact that I didn't want to spend 300 bucks on headphones.  I think they are great.  Here's my breakdown:

Fit: They fit great and are extremely flexible to varying head types.  They are comfortable and don't place extra stress against your ears or jaw line, like other models do.

Sound:  I am very happy with the sound.  Very clear and crisp with minimal static.  I will say if you are listening to piano solos or classic instrumental sounds, you can hear very minor static in the background, but not enough to ruin your listening experience.

Quality:  Since my last set of Sony's broke within a week, I can already say the quality is better.  However, they are made of a nicer metal so they appear that they will last longer.  Also, the ear parts are very comfortable and appear well made.

Miscellaneous:  I have BIG ears.  My ears tend to actually fit inside of the ear pieces.  This helps with noise cancellation part.

Recommendations:  Overall I am very satisfied with this product.  The quality seems great, the sound is crisp, and the price was perfect.

author: Caleb Robbins
title: Okay
content: It arrived sooner than expected which is always great. There were, however, a few things I disliked about the product. The part that goes against your ear seemed too small (if it was big enough to surround my ear instead of smashing it, it would have been better.) The volume I always have to adjust on the computer. Instead of button, perhaps a turning dial would be better for adjusting volume. It's still a great pair of headphones. I recommend it definitely. The product would be better if the adjustments I listed above are applied to future ones.

author: Bunmi Palmer
title: Great value for money.
content: I bought a pair of these headphones as a replacement set of headphones for my younger daughter. I must say that I am impressed with the quality of these headphones that a far better than the more expensive ones that they are replacing. I love how they can be easily be folded up and put into a headphone case. I love that they are well constructed and are unlikely to break if my daughter accidentally drops them. This is why we had to replace her previous pair. My daughter says that she loves the sound quality and the ease with which she can fold and put them into her previous headphone bag. I would certainly recommend these headphones to someone looking to get a quality pair for on a budget.

author: MG
title: Awesome
content:
I love them.
Likes: They came in a tiny, tiny box all folded up neatly, so I can tell they're quite portable. They fit my head well, and are pretty comfortable. The end of the wire is protected by metal, to stop from bending or fraying. They're low profile. They sound great, especially for the price.
Dislikes: They hurt my ears after a while, but i've found that is the case with most over-ear headphones.

author: Dallas High Mileage Business Traveler
title: Avoid this product, it bricked my iPad
content: The look and feel of these headsets was great for the price. The sound and volume were also great for the price. However, cheap prices come with cheap components, and in this case it was the 3.5mm jack quality. Within just a few weeks of use, the jack started to show excessive wear, the plastic part of it (it's not a solid metal jack like you'd find on a better quality headset" started having signs of color change indicating the plastic was being stressed. within a month it had broken where I had to "wiggle" the jack connection to get it in the perfect spot to have stereo from my iPad. Finally this weekend, it broke. While being disconnected. Leaving half the jack inside the iPad, out of reach. So now my iPad is fully broken. I can't extract the part that broke off as it's too deep in the jack, and and the iPad won't play audio through the speakers because it thinks a headphone is plugged in. I'm going to have to spend $100 to have a iPad repair joint take the iPad apart to manually extract the broken part. So glad I saved $5 on this headset so that after maybe two months of use my $600 iPad is unusable for anything requiring Audio.

author: Honi Owens
title: Nicely designed headphones for a great price
content: Very good Headphones for the price. They are adjustable but I will say if you have small head they might be a little big on you and not form properly to your ears for noise control. The ear pads are very comfortable and the Headphones are designed nicely. They have a built in mic which is great. They fold up nicely for easy storage and I love the plug it’s metal plated with a spring so there’s not bending of the cord.

author: Kristy White
title: Great Sound!
content: These headphones are great to fold up and carry with you wherever you go. Ever since they arrived my 3 year old son has been trying to use them. They have good sound quality and have a nice design that makes them easy to use. I have attached 3 pictures. One of the box, one of the headphones folded up, and one with them out and ready to use. The price is great for these headphones and worth the money well spent!

author: Brian Penzone
title: I've purchased three already- best headphones for the money!
content: I first purchased a set for my son, thinking that they're cheap, they likely don't work that well, but that's all I needed. Boy was I wrong! These perform like headphones three times the price. They take the constant abuse of a 6 year old without breaking a sweat. I purchased a set for myself and one for noise-cancelling at work and couldn't be happier. I would whole-heartedly recommend these to anyone who is looking for quality at low price.

author: Shoppingislife
title: You must buy!!!
content: AMAZING!!!! Seriously this is the best gift I have given myself. I work in an office where people won’t shut up. Annoying AF. I always have head phones but can still hear them in the background. I tested these babies today and I’m so happy. Also mad that it took 4 years to get them. Not only are they inexpensive but they are also very cute!!!

author: Me
title: Great headphones
content: These are fantastic headphones for the price. I purchased them for my son. He doesn't listen at high volume but I have to shout for him to hear me when he's wearing them so noise cancellation is great. They seem pretty lightweight and he loves the color. They fold nicely.

author: Nicole
title: Great headphones
content: Great headphones. I prefer Bluetooth head phones for myself but my daughter enjoys these to watch shows while relaxing. They are compact and foldable. Their also adjustable to fit anyone. Overall great quality and work great.

author: Tonya
title: Wonderful set, will buy again.
content: I love these headphones! They are a perfect size, for my head and ears. They can get loud and I like it. I also love how they can fold up. The plug for the headphones seem pretty sturdy, it does not seem like it will break as quick and as easy as other headphones

author: Maverick One
title: Best fifteen dollar headphones you can buy.
content: Just got these headphones and the reviews were right....for the price these are pretty remarkable. Most importantly the sound is excellent. You could tell someone you spent fifty bucks for them and after listening they wouldn't bat an eye. I recommend.

author: Sara random
title: Bester than best!
content: Gorgeous claret color! Arrived in 24 hrs! Best that money can buy for such an affordable price. I have an expensive pair, these beat them. And adjust for small head size too! Going to order a 2nd set as spare and some for gifts too! Excellent sound and pause button too!

author: Manthan
title: Best Headphones in Cheap Price
content:
In such a cheap price I liked the design of the headphones. Its easily portable, light weight, Microphone, Stereo and also it has the metallic Deco. The cable length is also good enough. This headphones are especially good if someone in playing video games or even listening music during the workout. The other thing I find more good is the metallic pin, because most of the headphones have the plastic pins which is breakable and metallic pin takes away the worry.

The only thing I dislike about it that it does not have a volume up or down button, it only has the pause and play button other than that there is nothing to complain about it.

author: J Harry McGrath
title: These headphones are as good as it better than the source most people plug headphones into
content:
EXCELLENT headphones !
I'm an audiophile.  I have other headphones I use with my high end home stereo.  These inexpensive headphones are almost as good as my high end ones.  My son has some of the headphones with a "b" on them.  His "b" headphones aren't quite as good as my high end headphines.  These inexpensive headphones are indistinguishable from his $150 "b" headphones when listening to a computer/tablet/phone.

author: Jonny Consumer
title: Great for two months, then stopped working
content:
I really wanted to like these headphones. They fit well and, at first, the sound quality was good. Especially for the price.

But this week they just stopped working. The cable near the plug is either loose or damaged, despite the fact that I leave them on my desk 24/7 and never move them beyond putting them on my head. Somehow, even with nearly zero movement, the plug wire has damaged itself.

author: KAYLEA FLEMING
title: These are great!
content: I bought these because I don't like having to constantly recharge bluetooth headphones, or having them die on me halfway through the day. These are great for the price and well worth the money. The cord really doesn't tangle, and they get very loud and cancel out all sounds around you, which is great if you're trying to watch a movie or something, but not so great if you're a parent trying to get your kid's attention while they have these on, cuz they definitely won't hear you. I highly recommend them.

author: Dustin Hoffman
title: Good sound quality and construction
content: These were purchased for my daughter. She said that they do a very good job canceling out noise, they cup to her ears well and are comfortable to wear. She is very satisfied with the product, and we're especially happy with the quality given the excellent price. She said that when she first used them, she heard a crackling that made her think there was a problem with the cord, but it hasn't come occurred again since then. Very solid value for the price. Would definitely recommend them for someone looking for an affordable pair of headphones.

author: E. Smith
title: Great Headphones
content: I was really skeptical searching for headphones, considering so many are so cheap and flimsy. I am glad to have found these, they are made of good materials, comfortable, good sound and actually have a little weight to them. Will definitely buy these again.

author: roland ekstrand
title: Work great but not dog prof
content: They worked well while they lasted. the sound quality was excellent and friends heard me much better with this microphone vs the one on the phone. They died early though, apparently they are not dog prof and became a chew toy when I set them beside me

author: Nunya Biznes
title: They Get Really Small When you Fold Them
content:
I was impressed with the size of the box they came in, and the price was just right considering the fact that headphones as an invention made by the human race have reached a point where they all must be brought together worldwide for the shameful proclamation that they are made too cheaply and break far too quickly as a general rule.

Here's hoping this pair will be above the grade curve.

The barcode sticker on the box said this was "without microphone", while the box itself said it came with the microphone. There's a little plastic thing on the cable with a hole on it and a button I can't figure out what it does. Maybe the hole is the microphone? There wasn't any documentation to speak of, which is probably for the best since it was manufactured in China for no good reason. No idea what would control the volume either. It's a shame, but not a necessary feature for my needs, so I like what I got.

I think if I would change something about this pair of headphones at the time of this writing, I would give it a somewhat longer cable. Otherwise, it seems to be a very nice pair of headphones.

author: Nicole Johnson
title: Way To Big
content: I was very dissapointed that when these headphones are set to the smallest setting they still rest most of the way off the bottom of your ears.  Instead of sitting where they should they hang over your ear lobes.  I hate to say something is worthless but these sat low even on my husbands who has a good sized head.  Uncomfortable and unusable!

author: ShelleLP
title: Durable and great sound. Has survived a teen aged boy.
content:
Edit to add: We have now had them almost a month and they are still in like-new condition. For my offspring that is a truly amazing thing, especially with a headset that has moving parts.  I will definitely be purchasing these again.

OP: I bought these to cover an emergency loss of prior headphones for a 15y/o. They were shipped right away and the boy was impressed with them. We both like the metal connector and the spring at the connection that will help prevent breakage at that point, a place that many of my son's headphone fail. He has used them for several days and hasn't had a single complaint (could be the end of days). More importantly, this affordably priced product is still working after four days despite the fact that my teen uses them 18 hours a day. There are a great many brands that can't make that boast. I am certain that there are higher quality (and more expensive) headphones out there, with all kinds of bells and whistles probably, but given how hard the boy can be on his hardware, I will be satisfied to come back to this brand again.

author: mjillian38
title: Great quality!
content: These are the perfect fut for my student in need.  I was looking fir quality headphones that permit students to access materials via high quality audio and these headphones are perfect!!!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Travel Headphones
content: For the price they are nice. But my main complaint THE PAIN! They are literally painful to wear on a regular basis which is why I say they are travel headphones. Or if you are a child with a small head I suppose that would be okay too. But I am and adult and my head is average sized and the pressure on my ears is PAINFUL. I am constantly having to adjust the headphones to let blood circulate, I constantly am bending the frame to relieve the pressure, but it is plastic so it doesn't help. The foam is cheap so it doesn't provide much cushion... What it needs is some sort of horizontal frame adjustment instead of relying on the pressure. Other than that the sound quality is good and they fold up very compact which is also good for travel.

author: Bama2324
title: Buy them! Loud, great sound quality
content:
I originally bought these for my 8 year old to use at school, but after trying them out I decided to keep them for myself!

The sound quality is excellent and it goes super loud (which is one of the reasons I decided not to give them to my son, he isn't ready for these and needs the noise limiting ones).

They are very sturdy and high quality, not cheap with flimsy plastic.

I love these and I think you will too!

author: Jess
title: Great Headphones for the price
content:
I ordered these headphones a few months ago, wanted to give them a try before posting a review.

1st impression the packaging was a small box, I wondered if I was going to get my money's worth.
The headphones are light weight and very compact, so if you travel frequently these are an inexpensive and great way to go.
The sound quality is good (I use them to watch movies, listen to podcasts or music).
So far the construction is solid.

I definitely recommend these for the cost vs quality.

author: BeckyC
title: Bargain
content: Although they don't fit as snugly on my head as others I have used, they are still sufficient for my needs. I am sitting stationary while wearing them so the lack of being snug isn't a big issue. The ear pieces are nicely padded and very comfortable. The sound is good too. All in all, they are a great buy.

author: Typetool
title: Quality love
content: Using then right now. Have been using them for a good 2 weeks or so? Plan on using them for another long time. They are definitely sexy at a price this low, and this good of quality! It has a spring at the end of the aux part so it won't mess up as easily. (Unlime my other 60$ headphones XD ) they come in this small looking box, almost disappointing. But I open them up and try them out. They sound just as good as my 60$ one. I'm confident the aux end will be safe for a long time. No need to worry if your pocket is bending it. So far 2 weeks in my pocket and it's good as new. It's seriously good quality at a low price. There's a mic but no actual volume control. Not that I found at least. Friends hear my fine over the phone and on my PS4. For anyone on a low budget trying to get some good headphones, this is it. For anyone on a high budget looking for something on the small side for travel, won't have to spend much, this is it. Love this headphones.

author: CrimsonCountess
title: Perfect fit for the Vogek on ear headphones.
content: Fits the on ear Vogek headphones nicely. I like the case since it is all black and seems like it will protect the headphones and is attractive and lightweight. I will be carrying my headphones with me along with my laptop and like that there is a designated case to keep them clean and organized. I also like the mesh pocket for the cord. I will likely also stash a pair of in ear phones in the pouch so I have a backup for another device.

author: Nolan Winkler
title: Very good headphones for the price, cord is quite long, microphone works well for calls
content: One of my main reasons for buying these headphones was to get some that I would not be able to lose easily and having the combination of over-ear headphones + the light-blue color definitely meet that goal. They work as intended for music purposes and calls definitely work well too, which is kind of cool to have a mic embedded in over-ear headphones. The cord is QUITE long, which can be bad semi-regularly as it tends to get caught on door handles etc. and even result in my phone getting flung. It can also be good at times to be able to  move away from my phone e.g. when exercising

author: Krushang
title: The Bass feel great
content: Even though they do not have cancelling noise as they cover your whole ear and the sound can be turned up really loud, you won’t miss the cancelling noise. The bass feels great but this headphones are programmed to deliver a clear and pure sound. The materials feel nice and they are really comfortable. Good product with good price

author: Lumberjack
title: Solid Headphones
content: I have purchased three different pairs of these headphones and they are all solid quality and are definite recommends I would make to others. I rate it as a 4 out of 5, instead of a 5 out of 5, since the price varies based on color. It should be a flat rate for all colors.

author: P. Riggs
title: Good for the Money!
content:
I got these in the mail earlier today. While I can't speak on the long term durability, they don't seem to be built cheaply by any means! I have used these to listen to Netflix and music. The balance of the sound is very middle of the line, which is perfectly fine for these types of headphones; they aren't specially designed for anything specific. At max volume on my computer, they don't seem to distort the sound too noticeably, which is good to have!  The noise cancellation with the sound off is decent, they aren't specifically built for it, but the foam does a good job of quieting sounds around you; and then with music, they keep your music contained.

They are comfortable and don't feel like they are putting too much pressure on my head or ears. They are definitely built for larger/ adult heads I would say. The chord also seems rigid enough to avoid kinks and tangles. The spring at the jack end is a nice addition!

Overall, I am happy with the rather inexpensive purchase, hopefully they last!

author: StarSava
title: Cheaply made but sounds amazing.
content: These were amazing headphones. Unfortunately they broke off in my LG thinq and now my phone is ruined. I am so mad. But I will say that besides that issue these headphones blow away my blue tooth ones. These are a plug in in case you didn't know. Great sound.

author: Metropolis
title: You get what you pay for
content: Static comes through the headphones if there's any slight movement of the 3.5mm wire. Ruins an otherwise decent sounding headset.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Very happy with purchase!
content: These work great.  I use them every night to listen to music when I'm working.  They're built solidly.  I couldn't be happier with this purchase.  I'll probably buy another pair for my wife.

author: RSeaman
title: Good sound quality at a very fair price.
content: Bought these headphones for work.  The sound quality is very good.  The head phones fit nicely around the ears and are comfortable.  Thought the headphones are adjustable for different sized heads, they were a bit big for mine at their smallest setting.  They might not be the best fit option for people with smaller heads or children.  I don't believe they have volume control, which I would prefer they did. All in all, I am happy with them, including performance and esthetics.

author: Laurel
title: Great Awesome Affordable Headphones
content: I really enjoyed this product overall! The headphones are a great quality, price, and awesome costumer service! I would only change one aspect about the head phone. I wish that others around me could not hear what I am listening too, this might be distracting. However I have a really enjoyable sound and can enjoy my music!  I also enjoy that there is a mental coil around the headphone jack. It makes the headphone seem like they would be more difficult to break. AGAIN AWESOME :)

author: Anthony
title: It Works
content: These are great. I like that they are over the ear headphones but that they fold up in a compact way that fits nicely in my bag. They feel sturdy yet comfortable and the sound is good. The mic works well, although you may have to cup it with your hand if you are walking in a windy area...but the same is true with the mic on a phone. All in all, I am happy with the purchase. I would say that I would buy it again, but I am hoping that they will last and I wont have to :)

author: Amazon Customer
title: Excellent affordable headphones
content:
I was looking for basic, wired, headphones for watching shows on the PS4. For the price, these are perfect. Sound quality is great and they are comfortable to wear. The plug in end seems a little excessive to me with the "silver plated" end that also has a spring after to help prevent breaking the wire (see photo). But again, for the price, definitely exceeded my expectations, especially with all the other options out there.

Only downside so far.....
This was not made for people with small heads. I wouldn't say I have a small head, but I definitely don't have a big head. I have to have this set to the smallest setting, and it just fits, it's actually a tad loose on top, but it works. So if you have a smaller head, THIS WON'T FIT!

Edit: these $15 headphones have the sound quality of $50 headphones, if you are looking for something affordable with great quality, these are it!

author: Jalisa Hickam
title: Pro's mostly.
content:
So the package arrived earlier my first thought was "Wow this is very small..."

But when you open it up they are huge!

They fold down great, And the colors are true to what they look like when you order.

Sound volume is good noise cancellation is alright. Not a big deal but for the cost of these it is pretty good not so cheep like you normally would get.

Pretty heavy duty, Specially for kids, They are big which is why it's nice.

author: linda bennett
title: Great product!
content: I'm probably the only person who can't wear earbuds because they refuse to stay in my ears, so I bought these actual headphones.  I took them to the gym tonight and was amazed how much better the sound is compared to tiny little ear buds, and they stayed put on my ears. They aren't necessarily noise cancelling, but they do cut way down on surrounding noise. I think these are a great product and very reasonably priced.

author: Coletrain
title: Seems like a good buy, read review.
content: Great affordable set of headphones. I bought 2, for 2 kids. There is no volume control, but the tablet provides that. The noise canceling must be decent, because I have to yell to get the kids attention. I thought is was a good buy. 3 months later, one no longer works. I am fairly handy and was unable to diagnose the issue, like did they pull to hard on a cord or something, I can't see it. I am not sure wether it quit due to abuse, or malfunction. I certainly would believe any abuse it may have undergone, but I am not aware of it. That would have been the difference between 4 and 5 stars.. Or for that matter, less stars.

author: Endiyer Reinoso
title: Great sound and noise reduction!
content:
Great sound, easy to pair. Noise reduction is great. The design provides good passive noise reduction, and, when turned on, the active noise cancellation made the music sound even better. Just received today and have only used a couple hours, so I cannot yet confirm the stated battery life. I am very glad I decided to try these! I was a bit concerned, with limited reviews. No regrets!

One final benefit for me- it adjusts down to fit my small head!! Many headphones are too big, but these are perfect!!

author: Kindle Customer
title: Nice headphones - the microphone isn't great
content: If you aren't going to use the microphone for recording, these headphones are great. Unfortunately, I recorded an hour's worth of audio and the sound was horrible. I had to go back to my half-broken MPOW headphones to record.  Don't try to record anything with them, you'll be disappointed. I use these headphones to listen to music and podcasts all the time. They're comfortable and the sound is good.

author: brandi
title: don't waste your money
content:
My 14 year old son uses these headphones for gaming and music. He loves them! This was a really great product for a great price.
Update: After only occasional use, these headphones no longer work... The thing that really stinks, is the window to return them closed only 10 days ago. I'm really upset that these quite after only a few weeks.

author: Terrikon
title: Excellent sound quality
content: Maybe I am out of date, I did not really expect much out of this headphone. I needed a headphone at work so I can block the noise at work. Well, this thing is really cheap and out of my surprise the sound quality was excellent. It is over my head fells really comfy. It also can fold for storage, I think I am going to take this with me on the plane too, it will serve well to watch movies. Great product

author: Amazon Customer
title: Declared best ever
content: These were purchased for my daughter whose previous headphones broke and she has already declared them the "best ever " she said they are comfortable, a good size and they block out her brother so she can hear her school work on them.  We will be ordering another her her brother now.

author: Grace
title: great headphone to start...after 1 week the buzzing started
content:
the headphones worked perfect in the inception.  but after only about 1 week of use and not much at that, a buzzing noise started.  after purchasing, i went on vacation so couldn't return with the amazon 30 day warranty and reached out directly to the company b/c they also offer a guarantee.  but i've received no reply.

perhaps i got a fluke bad headset but the company being unresponsive isn't a good sign.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Fits my head just fine and great value!
content: I'm writing this review with the price of the product in mind. These little guys do everything I need them to do and more. I am satisfied with the audio quality, they fit my head just fine (which I wasn't sure about after reading some reviews) and I don't have a large head. I love how they fold flat for storage and the cable seems to be one that will last the test of time. I couldn't ask for more from these headphones.

author: Panda World
title: Convenient Portable Headphones: Great Value
content: After ordering my headphones, I was happy to receive them very quickly. They arrived in very good condition in a small compact box. I love how the headphones fold up to be very compact and easily portable. It's compact size will easily fit into your purse, backpack, briefcase or luggage so you can enjoy it's use wherever you go. I was pleased with the sound quality on the headphones, it was clear and the bass sounded powerful. The ear pads were very soft and comfortable, which is a big plus. The headphones are adjustable to fit most size heads and I was able to use the microphone on the headphones to converse which was a nice feature. The buttons on the microphone allowed me to play and pause the music and also allowed me to skip to the next song or the previous one. However, I wish the microphone features were also compatible with a PC and laptop instead of just a phone and tablet. Overall the headphones worked well, were comfortable, and are a very convenient portable size. I would recommend these headphones and they are a good value

author: genefamilyschoolhouse
title: Good option for older kids travelling
content: Initially we wanted to buy kids' size headphone for a long trip overseas, but we ended up purchasing these headphones for each of our children. It is probably too large for most toddlers but they will likely grow out of any kids' size headphones after a short amount of time. Our 6 year old could wear these headphones just fine; granted he does have a large head but the kids' size ones were way too tight. Another issue we came across with the kids' size options was that the sound was very limited, since manufacturers want to limit the decibels. I understand this but they are not a good option on a noisy plane. As very intentional parents, we first checked the volume on this headset and then offered it to our kids; this way they could hear perfectly over the noisy in-flight noises and still be safe, hearing-wise. These are excellent in sound quality; they are a night and day difference between the standard kids' sized options out there on Amazon. I am extremely satisfied with the purchase and would highly recommend for similar use.

author: BrookTrout
title: Good Headphones for the money
content: There are great compact headphones, that I don't mind throwing in my computer bag and bringing places with me.  I like that they don't have to be charged, like other headphones I have.  These will work great at home, for school and at work!

author: Ed Brill
title: Very good value
content:
The headsets were purchased for use in a gym.  They proved to be lightweight, cancelled external noise well, and were easy to use.  I use them on  a treadmill and they remained in place, were comfortable, and distracted me from the boredom of walking to nowhere for hours on end.
For the price, they were great!  Highly recommend these.

author: Robert J. O'Connor
title: connector does not properly align when plugged in
content: I assume the connector's stereo inputs are not properly aligned because I had to jiggle the hell of out a cord to get both channels to play.
